meanings.definition: Not clear enough to be read
meanings.sent1: The handwriting on the old letter was illegible to me.
meanings.sent2: The smudged ink made the note illegible to everyone.
meanings.sent3: Trying to decipher the illegible menu at the restaurant was like solving a mystery.
meanings.sent4: The fog was so thick that it made the road signs illegible.
meanings.sent5: The faded text on the ancient scroll was completely illegible.

meanings.sent1: The tiny print on the medicine bottle was illegible without a magnifying glass.
meanings.sent2: The worn-out map became illegible after being folded too many times.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked across the newspaper, making the article illegible with its paw prints.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like an illegible book, hard to understand and interpret.
meanings.sent5: The cryptic message was intentionally made illegible to keep it a secret.
